required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of IMMH-010 in Patients With Advanced Malignant Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Clinical Trial of IMMH-010 in Patients With Advanced Malignant Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: Phase I study of IMMH-010 in patients with advanced malignant solid tumors

detailed_description.textblock: To evaluate the safety and tolerance of single and multiple doses of IMMH-010 in patients with advanced solid tumors; To determine the maximum-tolerated dose (MTD) and recommended Phase II dose (RP2D) of IMMH-010; To evaluate the effects of food on the pharmacokinetic profiles after single dose of IMMH-010 in patients with advanced solid tumors.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Part A Dose escalation study：At the end of Cycle 1 (Cycle0 is 7 days，Cycle1 is 21 days)
primary_outcome.description: To identify the dose-limiting toxicity (DLT) in dose escalation study.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of singing informed consent until the 30 days after the last study dose or the start date of a new anti-cancer therapy, whichever came first.
primary_outcome.description: Observe all the participants in any adverse events occurred during the period of clinical research, including clinical symptoms and signs of life, an abnormal in laboratory tests, record its clinical characteristics, severity, occurrence time, duration, treatment and prognosis, and determine its and the correlation between test drugs. NCI-CTCAE 5.0 standard was used to evaluate drug safety.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A Dose escalation study：At the end of Cycle1(Cycle0 is 7 days, Cycle1 is 21 days), Part B Food effect study: At the end of Cycle0（Cycle0 is 15 days), Part C Dose expansion study: At the end of Cycle1(Cycle1 is 21 days)

Part A Dose escalation study：At the end of Cycle1(Cycle0 is 7 days, Cycle1 is 21 days), Part B Food effect study: At the end of Cycle0 (Cycle0 is 15 days), Part C Dose expansion study: At the end of Cycle1(Cycle1 is 21 days)

Part A Dose escalation study：At the end of Cycle1(Cycle0 is 7 days, Cycle1 is 21 days), Part B Food effect study: At the end of Cycle0 (Cycle0 is 15 days), Part C Dose expansion study: At the end of Cycle1(Cycle1 is 21 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until the date of first documented progression or date of death from any cause, whichever came first (up to approximately 2 years).
secondary_outcome.description: ORR is defined as the percentage of participants who have best overall response (BOR) of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) at the time of data cutoff as assessed by RECIST 1.1.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until the date of first documented progression or date of death from any cause, whichever came first (up to approximately 2 years).
secondary_outcome.description: DOR is defined as the time from the first documentation of CR or PR to the date of first documentation of disease progression or death (whichever occurs first) as assessed by RECIST 1.1.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until the date of first documented progression or date of death from any cause, whichever came first (up to approximately 2 years).
secondary_outcome.description: DCR is defined as the percentage of participants who have BOR of CR or PR or stable disease (SD) at the time of data cutoff as assessed by RECIST 1.1.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until the date of first documented progression or date of death from any cause, whichever came first (up to approximately 2 years).
secondary_outcome.description: PFS is defined as the time from the first study dose date to the date of first documentation of disease progression as assessed by RECIST 1.1.

other_outcome.time_frame: Part A Dose escalation study：every 3 weeks for Cycle2- Cycle 6(each Cycle is 21 days), every 6 weeks for Cycle7- Cycle N(each Cycle is 21 days)
other_outcome.description: Percentage of T, B, and NK cells, CD8 + T cells, and CD4 + T cells in blood.
When the tumor tissue specimens are enough, we will run exploratory detections of biomarkers such as MSI-H/dMMR and tumor mutational burden (TMB).
Expression of PD-L1 from the archival tumor tissue slices or fresh tumor tissues.

arm_group.description: Part A Dose escalation study: 60mg, QD, Cycle0Day1, Cycle1Day1-CycleN
Part A Dose escalation study:120mg, QD, Cycle0Day1, Cycle1Day1- CycleN
Part A Dose escalation study: 240mg, QD, Cycle0Day1, Cycle1Day1- CycleN
Part A Dose escalation study:360mg, QD, Cycle0Day1, Cycle1Day1- CycleN

intervention.description: Part A Dose escalation study: 60mg, QD, Cycle0Day1, Cycle1Day1-Cycle N/120mg, QD, Cycle0Day1, Cycle1Day1- Cycle N/240mg, QD, Cycle0Day1, Cycle1Day1- Cycle N/360mg, QD, Cycle0Day1, Cycle1Day1- Cycle N IMMH-010 will be administered until disease progressioncor un-tolerable toxicity or disease progression or the treatment discontinuation criteria specified in the protocol appear. Part B Food effect study:120mg(Anticipated), QD, Cycle0Day1, Cycle0Day8, Cycle1Day1- Cycle N. IMMH-010 will be administered until disease progressioncor un-tolerable toxicity or disease progression or the treatment discontinuation criteria specified in the protocol appear. Part C Dose expansion study:120mg(Anticipated), QD, Cycle1Day1- Cycle N. IMMH-010 will be administered until disease progressioncor un-tolerable toxicity or disease progression or the treatment discontinuation criteria specified in the protocol appear.
